ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned new vocabulary and grammar patterns for Chinese language and have become more comfortable speaking in and listening to Chinese.
I greatly improved my Chinese speaking, reading, and listening abilities. I learned a lot of Chinese grammar and feel like a much more competent conversationalist.
I improved my knowledge of chinese, chinese culture, tones and grammar patterns.
Further developing my Chinese language skills and got more comfortable speaking Chinese.
Reading, writing, speaking and listening to Chinese
This class was great. I learned various new sentence patterns and started exploring upper-level vocabulary.
I became much better at Chinese

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: not too stressful, many assignments dispersed the grade, pretty fun; Weaknesses: high workload, lots of assignments and types of projects

Strengths: if you engage with the class and do all of the assignments, you are guaranteed to improve your Chinese language ability. This is an intensive course, but in a good way! Small class sizes allow for connection between classmates.
Weaknesses: grading was often uneven between classes. Some of the units (like the business language one) did not feel very applicable to daily life.
It follows a similar pattern to L3 so begins to wear after a while but overall mostly strengths! The chinese department at Yale are incredible and work very hard to make chinese enjoyable.
Strengths were the emphasis on oral Chinese. Weaknesses were the rigidity of the format which became tedious over time.
Super thorough and comprehensive study of the Chinese language. I enjoyed this course and learned so much
I believe that corrections should be allowed on essays for some points back

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! The workload is a little high, but learning Chinese at Yale is really great. The professors are all very nice and supportive, and you learn a lot by the end of each semester.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student! If you want to learn Chinese, this is a great and well-organized course.
Yes!! Your chinese level will improve rapidly
Yes, it is a great stepping stone to becoming fluent in Chinese.
Absolutely! As long as they are willing to put in the time and effort
Yes, if you are dedicated and take this class, your Chinese will certainly improve.
It is a great way to make friends and learn a  language
